items.name: The True Knight
items.description: A pact to uphold truth. The false slung broken upon their lies.

items.name: Punitive Stroke
items.description: Make a melee attack against a known liar. Get +[[/r d10 #damage]] to the attack, ignoring armour.

items.name: Honesty
items.description: Restore SPI when you tell the truth where a lie might be more beneficial.

items.name: kite shield
items.description: Marked with a symbol of the truth

items.name: The Snare Knight
items.description: Immersed within the woods. A sheriff of natural order

items.name: Wild Eye
items.description: Observe a beast in secret. Learn a useful truth about their habitat.

items.name: Empathy
items.description: Restore SPI when you spare the life of a hostile animal.

items.name: Handaxe attached to Wildrope
items.description: Attached to Wildrope. (strong rope that blends perfectly into foliage),

items.name: The Tourney Knight
items.description: A calling brought a life of combat. Nay a protector, in fact a competitor.

items.name: Champion Vow
items.description: Use immediately before a combat where there is a prize at stake. +[[/roll d6 #damage]] to melee attacks for the whole combat.

items.name: Hatred
items.description: Restore SPI when you refuse a plea for forgiveness.

items.name: Greatlance
items.description: Hefty when mounted, slow on foot

items.name: The Bloody Knight
items.description: Some were born to fight. This one birthed from the very blood of battle.

items.name: Bloody Echo
items.description: Use immediately after defeating an opponent. Your next melee attack in this combat gains Blast.

items.name: Justice
items.description: Restore SPI when you restore the balance of justice.

items.name: Brutal plate
items.description: A1 only when Wounded

items.name: Sacks of very strong alcohol, to which you're largely resistant
The Moss Knight
items.description: The tree and stone had no need to be taught. The wisest knew to study beneath them.

items.name: Mosstongue
items.description: Speak with uncut stones and particularly old trees. If you push them for too much knowledge they rebuke you, shunning you for the rest of the day.

items.name: Naturality
items.description: Restore SPI when you reject an opportunity to sleep indoors, sleeping in nature instead.

items.name: The War Knight
items.description: Forged and broken in the bloodied mud. Won some, lost some, ever survived.

items.name: Battle Awareness
items.description: When fighting in a combat with at least 3 combatants on each side all your Gambits count as Strong Gambits.

items.name: Duty
items.description: Restore SPI when you answer the call for martial service under a superior.

items.name: The Willow Knight
items.description: The giants fought the storm, falling, all broken bones. The youth, thrown about, arose in the calm.

items.name: Bend with the Wind
items.description: When you use a Gambit to Move you count as having Armour 4 until your next turn. This does not stack with your actual armour.

items.name: Doubt
items.description: Restore SPI when you defer to somebody more senior than you, even though you disagree.

items.name: Youthful Energy
items.description: Use once only to treat a Mortal Wound as a normal wound)

items.name: The Gilded Knight
items.description: A beacon of the brave and bold. All cloaked and masked in sunnen gold.
items.flavorLabel1: Where did the armour show itself?

items.name: Martyr-in-Waiting
items.description: Use as a reaction to being Mortally Wounded. Allies fighting with you regain [[/roll d6 #guard]]GD and get +[[/roll d12 #damage]] against your attacker for the combat.

items.name: Pride
items.description: Restore SPI when you take personal credit for a great victory.

items.name: Gold-masked helm
items.description: Opponents who know the value of gold have their first ever attack against you Impaired

items.name: The Saddle Knight
items.description: Within a blink they were atop their steed. Knight and beast at one, a red streak in the green.

items.name: Song of the Steed
items.description: Speak in a voice comprehensible to horses. They need reasoning with rather than commanding.

items.name: Certainty
items.description: Restore SPI when you prove somebody wrong.

items.name: Rider's plate
items.description: A1 when mounted

items.name: Fine saddle and tack
items.description: You can never be dismounted

items.name: Rider's axe
items.description: +[[/roll d6 #damage]] when mounted, can be thrown

items.name: Rider's axe
items.description: +[[/roll d6 #damage]] when mounted, can be thrown

items.name: Rider's axe
items.description: +[[/roll d6 #damage]] when mounted, can be thrown

items.name: The Riddle Knight
items.description: The right words say everything and nothing. A different truth to each ear.

items.name: Twisted Words
items.description: Speak, but choose two different meanings, as different as you wish, even total opposites. Choose which meaning each listener takes from the words.

items.name: Integrity
items.description: Restore SPI when you discredit somebody unworthy of their position.

items.name: Moon pendant
items.description: Grants the wearer a false form under moonlight, [[/roll roling #table-knight-the-riddle-knight]] each night

items.name: The Talon Knight
items.description: The claw is nothing without the eye. The eye is nothing without the wing.

items.name: Flockbond
items.description: See through the eyes of your bird, and learn the local knowledge of any prey it eats.

items.name: Regret
items.description: Restore SPI when you burn a part of your past.

items.name: Hookhammer
items.description: +[[/roll d8 #damage]] dropping from above

items.name: The Barbed Knight
items.description: Cruelty can bring a peace. Stone and spikes split into bloom.

items.name: The Red Hunt
items.description: Once each day, infuse a target’s spilt blood into an arrow to give it +[[/roll d12 #damage]] against the target. You can also taste a small amount of the blood to get a glimpse of their location.

items.name: Apathy
items.description: Restore SPI when you reject a call for comfort.

items.name: Jagged Spear
items.description: +[[/roll d8 #damage]] against a target you have Wounded or Scarred

items.name: The Trail Knight
items.description: More than foxes leave trails in their stead. Comings and goings laid plain as a thread

items.name: Strands of Past
items.description: By studying the ground for a whole Phase you can ask a single yes or no question about what happened here in the past few days.

items.name: Fear
items.description: Restore SPI when refusing to go into the dark.

items.name: Sanguine lens
items.description: Traces of blood appear obvious when viewed through this

items.name: The Amber Knight
items.description: Their wait has been longer than we could imagine. Their blade slow but unstoppable

items.name: Patient Strike
items.description: Make a melee Attack when you have not moved this turn. +[[/roll d10 #damage]] to the Attack. Ignore the target’s Armour and immunities of any sort. If this fails to defeat the opponent, take [[/roll d6 #damage]] Damage yourself.

items.name: Avarice
items.description: Restore SPI when you gain significant wealth.

items.name: Amber amulet
items.description: If placed in a fire, carries its warmth for a whole day

items.name: The Horde Knight
items.description: In fury’s reign afore the rav’ning throng. In chaos born as knight where beast belong

items.name: Pack Tactics
items.description: Use before attacking with at least one ally. You may combine any number of dice into larger dice with a value equal to the total of the combined dice, to a maximum of d12 Damage. For example, combining a d4 and a d8 into a d12.

items.name: Prestige
items.description: Restore SPI when you take credit for the deeds of another.

items.name: Rations from home
items.description: See below

items.name: The Emerald Knight
items.description: A verdant cloak on sable steed. Neath nature’s veil, yond sight and heed

items.name: Fade to Green
items.description: Use when hiding still and silent in greenery. You cannot be found by any means. While hiding you can only perform a specific type of action without revealing yourself, but also benefit from a heightened sense (see below).

items.name: Elegance
items.description: Restore SPI when you leave a place more beautiful than you found it.

items.name: Branchspear
items.description: When stabbed into a tree it is immovable by anyone but you

items.name: Cloaked mail
items.description: A1 in verdant environments only

items.name: The Chain Knight
items.description: Born below the soil, below the stone, below all thought. Down, down, further down, of blood and iron wrought

items.name: Will of the Irons
items.description: Move a single chain that you touch as if it was a limb. You can lash out with both ends ([[/roll d6 #damage]] each), grasp opponents, and otherwise move it to your will.

items.name: Abyss
items.description: Restore SPI when sleeping underground in complete darkness

items.name: Oubliette mail
items.description: Wrapped in a Long iron chain

items.name: The Banner Knight
items.description: Beware of those festooning the flag. Their blade may be idle but their comrades are sharpened

items.name: Rousing Presence
items.description: Use once per Attack when you are part of a group Attack. You may reroll the entire pool of Attack dice once only.

items.name: Sensitivity
items.description: Restore SPI when receiving social approval.

items.name: Banner-pike
items.description: See below, lose [[/roll d6]] SPI if the banner ever falls to the ground in battle

items.name: The Pigeon Knight
items.description: The humble know no home in place. For such wanderers, the horizon is their hearth

items.name: Wayfinder Sense
items.description: Sense the direction in which a particular goal lies, but not the best route to travel there. You cannot use this to find your lost home or the City.

items.name: Inquisition
items.description: Restore SPI when you wrangle the truth out of an uncooperative person.

items.name: Bitterglaive
items.description: +[[/roll d8 #damage]] vs targets within their home

items.name: Patchwork mail with hooded cloak
items.description: Can be used to vanish into a significantly large crowd

items.name: The Shield Knight
items.description: In wood, hide, or iron, as armour meek or grand. No greater shield for the weak than the oath-sworn Knight’s own hand

items.name: Death Ward
items.description: Use when a nearby ally would take a Mortal Wound or be killed outright. You take a Mortal Wound instead.

items.name: Mortality
items.description: Restore SPI when you see an ally suffer a Mortal Wound.

items.name: Soothing salve
items.description: You prepare enough for one use each day, restores VIG, see below

items.name: The Whip Knight
items.description: Some draw screams from wrent flesh and bone. Others have ways to make very soul moan

items.name: Pain Strike
items.description: Make a melee Attack on your own. Damage is applied to GD as normal, but then to SPI in place of VIG. If the target loses half of their SPI from this Attack they lie broken before you.

items.name: Reverence
items.description: Restore SPI when offering respectful homage to the dead.

items.name: Strange herbs
items.description: Different effect each time, see below. Enough for one dose each day. Effects wear off after an hour, but Virtue Loss remains

items.name: The Seal Knight
items.description: A Knight’s sworn oath outlasts the stone wall. Yet Seers say in time even words must fall

items.name: Knight to mark it with your seal.
items.description: They can use Deny as if they were a Knight, but then the seal is removed.

items.name: Modesty
items.description: Restore SPI when refusing a reward

items.name: Siege plate
items.description: When the wearer braces against a door it cannot be breached

items.name: 3 runic scrolls
items.description: See below, can only be read by Seers, who value them greatly

items.name: The Horn Knight
items.description: Horn cried, hearts asank, blood awoke. In its wail our fates all sealed as the feast for death

items.name: Carnage Fanfare
items.description: Blow the wild horn in battle. For the rest of this battle any VIG lost through Damage is doubled. This affects all involved in the battle, whether they hear the horn or not.

items.name: Bluntness
items.description: Restore SPI when you move the conversation in a way that somebody is avoiding.

items.name: Antler-halberd
items.description: +[[/roll d10 #damage]] vs horned or antlered opponents

items.name: Wild horn
items.description: See below

items.name: The Dove Knight
items.description: In serenous moon the best of us can rest in docile light. That quietest bird in impure times must soar in bloody flight

items.name: Strike of Serenity
items.description: Make a melee Attack against a wounded target. Get +[[/roll d8 #damage]] to the Attack. If this defeats the target then all allies restore SPI.

items.name: Vengeance
items.description: Restore SPI when achieving a worthy revenge

items.name: Winged scale
items.description: Can’t fly, but see below

items.name: Bright weeds
items.description: Create a cool glow when crushed to a powder

items.name: The Story Knight
items.description: At last, I’m here!. The one you were waiting for, the one behind the words

items.name: Weaver of Fate
items.description: Just before night falls, tell a story related to a nearby place, noting two details past, present, or future. The Referee secretly chooses one of them to become truth. This can only be performed once per location.

items.name: Showmanship
items.description: Restore SPI when you deliberately draw unwanted attention.

items.name: Book of stories
items.description: Something for everyone, see below for a random tale

items.name: The Turtle Knight
items.description: I stand inclad in shelldy stead. Nawone of you will see me dead!

items.name: Unbreakable Shell
items.description: Use at the start of your turn. You cannot move, but double the Armour score of your shield and gain +[[/roll d6 #damage]] when attacking with a shield.

items.name: Wellrestedness
items.description: Restore SPI when you sleep for two consecutive Phases.

items.name: Drinking horn
items.description: Makes even disgusting liquids taste good, see below

items.name: The Key Knight
items.description: Sure as sky and sea. For every lock a key

items.name: Retroactive Forethought
items.description: Once per day, produce a common item from your backpack that you could have reasonably acquired at a recent point.

items.name: Distraction
items.description: Restore SPI when you abandon a set plan.

items.name: Ring of keys
items.description: For any lock there’s a 1-in-3 chance you can find a key that fits

items.name: Bag of ill-gotten gains
items.description: See below

items.name: The Moat Knight
items.description: There they stood, awashed in soddled loam. A grottling dance, the dusky sky agloam

items.name: Wading Stance
items.description: Gain 1 Armour and +[[/roll d6 #damage]] to all attacks when fighting in at least waist-high water.

items.name: Filth
items.description: Restore SPI when you become utterly filthy.

items.name: Barbed mail
items.description: Anyone trying to grab or hold you takes [[/roll d6 #damage]] Damage

items.name: Moat shovel
items.description: Any hole dug with this immediately begins to fill with water, stopping when full

items.name: The Boulder Knight
items.description: A fated charge in mail and stalward plate. Abaited foes await that thundring gait

items.name: Unstoppable Dash
items.description: When you are in motion you cannot be stopped, but sustain [[/roll d12 #damage]] Damage if breaking through a solid wall or object. You cannot sustain this motion for long distances.

items.name: Strength
items.description: Restore SPI when you complete a physical task that somebody else was struggling with.

items.name: Fancy plate
items.description: See below

items.name: Hand-written book
items.description: “Of Time-Tested Guidance in the Construction and Destruction of Fortresses, Ramparts, and Castles”

items.name: The Tankard Knight
items.description: Abrash and bold, renowned and rued. Their presence cheered on one breath, damned anext

items.name: Humble Glamourie
items.description: After eating and drinking with somebody for a few hours they consider you trustworthy enough to speak openly about anything you ask about. The next day they come to their senses and realise if they revealed too much.

items.name: Revelry
items.description: Restore SPI when socially overindulging.

items.name: Scar from a friend betrayed
items.description: See below

items.name: The Owl Knight
items.description: A fat one indeed who feasts on the fruits of fact. The nut of knowing nourishes from nog to nosh

items.name: Arboreal Archive
items.description: Spend a Phase running hands over a tree to access its memory, seeing anything that happened under its shade or over its roots.

items.name: Alertness
items.description: Restore SPI when you spot an ambush, trap, or surprise attack.

items.name: Sack of books
items.description: 1-in-2 chance you have a small snippet of information on any particular topic at hand, otherwise you find a miscellaneous tome, as below

items.name: The Hooded Knight
items.description: As deeds abound in history's script. More slip from time’s forgetful grip

items.name: Unnoticed Deed
items.description: Once per day you can retroactively declare an action that you took earlier that day, such as giving instructions to an ally, or gathering a specific piece of information. This cannot be used to acquire new items.

items.name: Anonymity
items.description: Restore SPI when somebody believes in a false identity you are portraying.

items.name: Cloak and hood
items.description: See below, while fully cloaked and hooded, people will see you in the moment, but have no memory of you once you pass from sight

items.name: The Lance Knight
items.description: Steed agasp, spear agroan, strike agore. Sharp afrail, sight ablind, then no more

items.name: Shattering Charge
items.description: Once per day, make a solo mounted charging Attack with a lance. The Attack gains +[[/roll d12 #damage]], Blast, and Gambits caused by the Attack count as strong. The lance is shattered.

items.name: Adventure
items.description: Restore SPI when you enter a Myth Hex.

items.name: Lance
items.description: Hefty if mounted

items.name: Mystic sight
items.description: You can see something you shouldn't be able to, see below

items.name: The Questing Knight
items.description: Dream of the commoner, tragedy of the knight. To die at rest, at peace, at quiet

items.name: Pledge Quest
items.description: Swear a quest to somebody who cares. Until you complete the quest you cannot regain lost GD, but get +[[/roll d12 #damage]] on all attacks against those who stand in your way. Lose [[/roll d12]] SPI if you abandon the quest.

items.name: Impetuosity
items.description: Restore SPI when you are first to fight.

items.name: Ancient sword
items.description: See below

items.name: Cold stone
items.description: Can absorb a single ailment from the wielder before vanishing in a burning light

items.name: The Ring Knight
items.description: With ring a’lone, head dreams of home. With rings o’two, heart fills with rue

items.name: Unbreakable Circle
items.description: Draw a circle in the ground, with yourself in the centre. Until you leave the circle, no other living being can enter or leave it.

items.name: Respectfulness
items.description: Restore SPI when returning something to its rightful owner after it was lost or taken.

items.name: Pair of rings
items.description: See below, can only be put on or removed at sunrise

items.name: The Forge Knight
items.description: Gravid beats on ferrous slab, thick air a crimson sheen. Each mallenstroke leaves scars aworn, apparent and unseen

items.name: Tempering Strike
items.description: When you cause a Wound with a melee weapon, that weapon receives +[[/roll d6 #damage]] until the end of combat. This effect can stack.

items.name: Burning
items.description: Restore SPI when you are wounded by fire.

items.name: Bolt-guisarme
items.description: Long in melee or slow in ranged

items.name: Scars from the forge
items.description: See below

items.name: Pots of forge dust
items.description: Spreads irritating gas in the area when broken, Impairing attacks from within. You can make more anywhere with a forge

items.name: The Rune Knight
items.description: Under gleam of lumenlight, in skin or stone ascratch. Strands of faten path unveiled, a starry scrawl to match

items.name: Destinous Sigil
items.description: At sunset, etch a cosmic rune somewhere secret on your person. Choose a number. When a die rolls that number you may adjust it to any other value on that die. This can be performed a number of times equal to the chosen number. A different number is chosen next sunset.

items.name: Foresight
items.description: Restore SPI when your prediction is proven to be correct.

items.name: Sealed crystal flask
items.description: See below, roll once only, and you know the effect

items.name: The Gallows Knight
items.description: In dregs of dawn the damnlings sway. For famine’s brood a gifted prey

items.name: Carrion’s Call
items.description: Speak with scavenger creatures, and summon them to you. They’re only helpful if you’re providing them with food.

items.name: Misery
items.description: Restore SPI when you meet somebody new and complain to them about something.

items.name: Neck-catcher
items.description: Wounded targets are snared securely around the neck, provided they have one

items.name: Salvaged armour
items.description: See below

items.name: Titan beads
items.description: 3 polished stones. When thrown they transform into a huge boulder mid-air, striking for [[/roll d10 #damage]] blast

items.name: The Tome Knight
items.description: A loom of wisdom spun at dawn. Laid to rest til coming morn

items.name: Dawn Contemplation
items.description: At sunrise each day, choose any area of knowledge. You can ask the Referee three questions within this area, which they answer honestly with yes, no, or maybe if uncertain.

items.name: Introversion
items.description: Restore SPI when you refuse a formal social gathering, or leave early.

items.name: Perfect recall
items.description: You remember everything you have ever experienced perfectly, with a few limitations, see below

items.name: The Meteor Knight
items.description: A star of truth, fell from ahigh. Such lumous ones should wear no lie

items.name: Star Fall
items.description: You never suffer Damage from falling, unless landing on something harmful. When you land from a fall of at least 12ft you may release a shockwave ([[/roll d8 #damage]] blast).

items.name: Authenticity
items.description: Restore SPI when you reveal your identity or intentions at an inconvenient moment.

items.name: Elaborate trident
items.description: See below

items.name: Moon oil
items.description: When rubbed on an object you could lift it renders the object weightless until washed with water

items.name: The Gazer Knigh
items.description: The blood sees through time aflow. To certain souls, a glimpse they show

items.name: Glimpse of Fate
items.description: Once per day you can undo a single action performed by you or your Company, declaring it was in fact a minor vision you received. Play as if it never happened.

items.name: Respect
items.description: Restore SPI when you yield to a Seer.

items.name: Toothed blade
items.description: D8 , +[[/roll d8 #damage]] against Seers

items.name: Tapestry cloak
items.description: See below

items.name: Flickerlamp
items.description: A warm lantern that casts its shadows toward the nearest Seer

items.name: The Mule Knight
items.description: A humble beast, no roar or flight. Beneath the grey a show of might

items.name: Lowly Shroud
items.description: At any time you may choose to have somebody observing you be utterly convinced that you are just a humble, unarmed peasant, and your steed a mule.

items.name: Kindness
items.description: Restore SPI when you stop an act of cruelty.

items.name: Weighted staff
items.description: Long

items.name: 3 explosives
items.description: [[/roll d8 #damage]] blast, see below

items.name: The Halo Knight
items.description: A trail of hope across the land. In sorrow’s face, bright reprimand

items.name: Luminous Eruption
items.description: Use once per Phase. A light source you are holding briefly illuminates the entire Hex and causes [[/roll d12 #damage]] Damage to nearby beings who live in darkness.

items.name: Valour
items.description: Restore SPI when you engage in combat against the odds.

items.name: Mistvial
items.description: When broken, thick mist rolls in over the whole Hex for the rest of the Phase. See below for repair requirements

items.name: The Iron Knight
items.description: As sword abend, as plate afold,. As shield asplint, a tale atold.

items.name: Heightened Sharpness
items.description: When you perform a Strong Gambit with a bladed weapon you may choose one of the following as the effect, the target receiving a Save as normal: • Take a limb • Take a head if their GD is 0

items.name: Diligence
items.description: Restore SPI when refusing a shortcut.

items.name: Cleavingblade
items.description: See below

items.name: Inscribed scabbard
items.description: Shows a different scene each morning, hinting at the nearest Myth

items.name: The Mirror Knight
items.description: In eyes ajust, the given got. Blow for blow, from one shared l

items.name: Reflection of Blood
items.description: When you are Wounded, the attacker suffers the same amount of VIG loss as you. When you are Scarred the attacker gets the same Scar.

items.name: Egality
items.description: Restore SPI when you give somebody else their fair share.

items.name: Hushingbell
items.description: Those who hear the bell hear nothing else

items.name: The Dusk Knight
items.description: Each touch of iron takes a price, in breath or blood or bone. A nasty cut takes something worse, the warmth of distant home

items.name: Sunder Memory
items.description: When you Wound a target you can rob them of a single specific memory. If it is a Mortal Wound then you can remove all memory of a specific place, thing, person, or event.

items.name: Temperance
items.description: Restore SPI when you refuse a luxury.

items.name: Pouch of wolfnuts
items.description: Repellent to canines

items.name: Poem on tattered parchment
items.description: See below

items.name: The Coin Knight
items.description: In arg or aur, decisions spun. A prize, a life, lost or won

items.name: Thrown to Chance
items.description: Use instead of attacking normally. Flip a coin. Heads the target is killed, tails you are killed. This is final.

items.name: Generosity
items.description: Restore SPI when you give generously to somebody in need.

items.name: Jaunty flute
items.description: Can only play a certain type of music, see below

items.name: The Mock Knight
items.description: Sycamore, leather, felt and strings. In heartless chest a soul still sings

items.name: Impression of Life
items.description: You do not need to breathe, eat, drink, sleep, or love, but still feel the drives.

items.name: Imitation
items.description: Restore SPI when you pass for human while under scrutiny.

items.name: Unnatural body concealed beneath plate suit, hood, and clothes
items.description: See below

items.name: The Mask Knight
items.description: You call for the truth from me?. I will not offer you that which cannot be found

items.name: Thousand Faces
items.description: You can assume the face of anybody you have touched, but your body and voice are unchanged.

items.name: Vigilance
items.description: Restore SPI when you prevent a betrayal.

items.name: Masked helm
items.description: See below

items.name: Star ink and parchment
items.description: Writing only shows under starlight at night

items.name: The Bone Knight
items.description: Ribble rabble, ronky donk, they bounce a duckle dine. Clatter clink, clanky tank, a rib, a skull, a spine

items.name: Bone Magnate
items.description: When you make a genuine trade, a bone for a bone, learn something about the individual that the acquired bone came from, or something that they knew in life.

items.name: Acumen
items.description: Restore SPI when you come out better from a bargain.

items.name: Needledagger
items.description: D6, +[[/roll d6 #damage]] against armoured targets

items.name: Box of bones
items.description: See below

items.name: The Salt Knight
items.description: Saline stink adwells in every depth. No matter how calm the surface

items.name: Inspire Ire
items.description: Activate at the end of your turn. Until the next turn, any enemies that Attack targets other than you lose [[/roll d10]] SPI after the Attack.

items.name: Mettle
items.description: Restore SPI when accepting a non-combat challenge with the odds set against you.

items.name: Everflask
items.description: Contains an endless supply of fresh water as  as its thirst is sated with each use, see below

items.name: The Violet Knight
items.description: A glow unseen, from neath a dream. Illuminates the fabric’s seam

items.name: Light Beyond Light
items.description: You can cause any metal object you hold to emit a bright light that only you can see. Bees, butterflies, and hedgehogs can also see the light.

items.name: Positivity
items.description: Restore SPI when you raise somebody’s mood.

items.name: Flattering handmirror
items.description: Shows the viewer’s ideal vision of themselves

items.name: The Cosmic Knight
items.description: Countless stars dotted in the night. To the eyes of one, each a stain of failure amid purest black

items.name: Celestial Retreat
items.description: While you can see the sky you can instantly vanish to a distant sanctuary, leaving a small glowing stone behind. You can rematerialise at the stone at any time.

items.name: Constellations
items.description: Restore SPI when you get tell somebody new about the stars as you point to them.

items.name: Strange crossbow
items.description: See below

items.name: Echostone
items.description: Can record and repeat one spoken phrase

items.name: The Temple Knight
items.description: No blood or cry. Not here, not today

items.name: Site of Respite
items.description: You may declare a building that you occupy as peaceful ground. Nobody within the building can bring themselves to attack until you leave.

items.name: Quietude
items.description: Restore SPI when bringing peaceful order to a chaotic place.

items.name: Mummified snake
items.description: Reptiles will not attack anyone holding it, it speaks to your mind directly, see below

items.name: The Fox Knight
items.description: A whimsied whirl, a crafty guise. The truth revealed as sour surprise

items.name: Cunning Ploy
items.description: Once per day, declare your current self to be an illusion, dispersing into smoke. The real you is watching from a safe place nearby.

items.name: Wits
items.description: Restore SPI when you avoid being tricked or outwitted.

items.name: Hidden blade
items.description: See below

items.name: Sealing wax
items.description: Can render any container watertight and airtight

items.name: The Gull Knight
items.description: Tattered wing, loath’ed cry, ugly bill. And yet what heights

items.name: Guiding Gust
items.description: Ascend to the top of a vertical surface you are touching, lifted on a burst of wind.

items.name: Joy
items.description: Restore SPI when you deliver good news.

items.name: Patchwork mail
items.description: See below

items.name: Blinding bracelet
items.description: Anybody wearing the bracelet is blind until they take it off

items.name: The Magpie Knight
items.description: Keen eyes see what cold heart seeks. No empty handed fool, this bird

items.name: Scourer’s Sense
items.description: If you are searching for something specific you always know for sure whether it is in your immediate surroundings or not.

items.name: Heraldry
items.description: Restore SPI when you announce the owner of a banner, crest, or coat of arms, which you can always recognise.

items.name: Twofold pouch containing a memento
items.description: Items you place in the pouch can only be retrieved by you, see below

items.name: The Reliquary Knight
items.description: Final rest, earned in life. The echos linger on

items.name: Spirit Call
items.description: Once per day, release the invisible spirit from your reliquary. It will follow a single, specific command. It acts with the general capacities of a normal human but can be invisible and immaterial as needed.

items.name: Tradition
items.description: Restore SPI when you ensure a tradition is thoroughly honoured.

items.name: Sack of history tomes, treasured reliquary
items.description: See below

items.name: The Vulture Knight
items.description: Gutly ribbons, blood’s sweet dance. The future calls in gory trance

items.name: Carrion Casting
items.description: Spread the innards of the recently dead across the ground. Ask a single question, they point you in a direction that would help.

items.name: Thrift
items.description: Restore SPI when you make good use of something you found discarded.

items.name: Black axe
items.description: D10 , +[[/roll d10 #damage]] vs wounded targets

items.name: Sinister mail
items.description: See below

items.name: Spidernip nuts
items.description: Acts as a pleasing stimulant for insects and arachnids when ground to a powder

items.name: The Free Knight
items.description: No body, no mind, should live acaged. Yet freedom rarely comes with a whispe

items.name: Bond Breaker
items.description: Strike a chain or lock with a metal weapon. Both shatter loudly.

items.name: Liberty
items.description: Restore SPI when you release somebody from an unwanted bond.

items.name: Hexshield
items.description: See below

items.name: Tempest chest
items.description: When empty, it can draw a storm within, restoring calm weather. If opened when full the storm is released

items.name: The Silk Knight
items.description: Judge not a knight on might and favour. Where silk endures, a heart can waver

items.name: Adamant Gossamer
items.description: You can draw thin strands of silky string of any length from your mouth. They are utterly unbreakable, but burn to ash in an instant.

items.name: Mercy
items.description: Restore SPI when you accept a surrender or plea for forgiveness.

items.name: Woven coat armour
items.description: No protection against fire

items.name: Intricate brass puzzle
items.description: Compelling but impossible

items.name: The Tiger Knight
items.description: The ignorant deem beastly realms as mere anarchy. In truth, the structure runs much deeper than our own

items.name: Bestial Renown
items.description: Each time you defeat an animal in a contest befitting its strengths, all animals of that type will react favourably to you.

items.name: Closure
items.description: Restore SPI when you get an answer that you’ve been seeking for some time.

items.name: Fang blades
items.description: [[/roll d8 #damage]] each when wielded as a pair

items.name: 3 phoenix feathers
items.description: Erupts in flame when dropped on the ground, [[/roll d8 #damage]] blast

items.name: The Leaf Knight
items.description: No greater gift than bough and bush. What more could we ask from this bountiful land?

items.name: Nature’s Vault
items.description: You can wield branches as javelins ([[/roll d6 #damage]]) or greatspears ([[/roll d10 #damage]] long) and eat leaves as a satisfying meal.

items.name: Gourmet
items.description: Restore SPI when you eat a new type of fruit or vegetable.

items.name: Verdant leather
items.description: While within foliage

items.name: Useful stick
items.description: See below

items.name: Murmur box
items.description: Creates the illusion of indistinct conversation when open

items.name: The Glass Knight
items.description: Revealer of all secrets, in stark, judgemental light. In cold and sharpened heart lies no deceitful curse

items.name: Touch of Glass
items.description: You can see through any surface that you place your hand upon.

items.name: Curiosity
items.description: Restore SPI when looking somewhere you really shouldn’t.

items.name: Painted mail
items.description: See below

items.name: Witching needle
items.description: A six-inch spike, can be stuck into any material, and cannot be removed by anybody but you or a Seer

items.name: The Hive Knight
items.description: A bed of gluous, parchly cloth, a coat of stickly sleen. Emerged in morning good as new, chirurgery unseen

items.name: Chrysaline Rebirth
items.description: At night you may immerse yourself in a cocoon through means you do not fully understand (see below). After a full day you emerge, your VIG restored, and any physical harm cured. This cannot cure death unless the process requires it.

items.name: Community
items.description: Restore SPI when you leave a community better off than when you arrived.

items.name: Tidal resin
items.description: When burned, all nearby water becomes still and solid for a while

items.name: The Ghoul Knight
items.description: Arise! Arise!. But, for what? For whom?

items.name: Rebuked by Death
items.description: Use when you are dead. Return to life. Your body is as you left it, as are your Guard and Virtue scores.

items.name: Acceptance
items.description: Restore SPI when warmly welcomed into somebody’s home.

items.name: Cleaner salt ,
items.description: Renders even the most rotten food safe and delicious

items.name: Wooden animal miniature
items.description: See below

items.name: The Weaver Knight
items.description: This and that, might just be that and this. As today were tomorrow, soon yesterday, no truth lies set in stone

items.name: Warp & Weft
items.description: Swap the positions of an object you are holding and another object you can see. They must be of a similar size and shape, such as two swords.

items.name: Detachment
items.description: Restore SPI when you discard something that you want.

items.name: Thrown weapon
items.description: See below

items.name: Hushcloth
items.description: Items fully wrapped in this cloth create no noise

items.name: The Thunder Knight
items.description: Thunder!. Should be felt, not heard, else call it a whimper!

items.name: Voice of the Skies
items.description: While outdoors, you can shout loud enough to be heard clearly throughout the whole Hex and all adjacent Hexes.

items.name: Discord
items.description: Restore SPI when you disrupt a place of order.

items.name: The Dust Knight
items.description: Lust and loathing, desire and ire. The two great forces, perhaps just one

items.name: Aqueous Repulsion
items.description: You can forcefully repel liquids with an outstretched hand, enough to hold a river at bay for a while.

items.name: Entitlement
items.description: Restore SPI when you get something that you were promised but initially denied.

items.name: Beckoning net
items.description: Fish wilfully swim into this fishing net

items.name: Preserved fish
items.description: See below

items.name: The Fanged Knight
items.description: I can show you why I cannot bare the false smile. Now bare your skin and harden your heart

items.name: Sink Teeth
items.description: You can bite (d6) someone, choosing one of the following effects before the bite, occurring only if you Wound them: Regain VIG equal to the VIG that they lose, lower them into normal sleep, show them one of your memories

items.name: Melancholy
items.description: Restore SPI when you dampen the mood.

items.name: Ancient scroll
items.description: Has references to places in this Realm, but outdated, see below

items.name: The Pearl Knight
items.description: Why lurk shellbound in abyssal depths, solitary for life?. All the best secrets come from the mouths and eyes of others
items.flavor: A blade taken from the sea

items.name: Gift from the Deep
items.description: Produce one pearl each morning, unless you haven’t given or traded your previous pearl. You can see through the eyes of anybody that is carrying one of your pearls.

items.name: Gossip
items.description: Restore SPI when you share or receive gossip.

items.name: Cleaving blade
items.description: See below

items.name: Salincense
items.description: Smoke from this candle causes plants to wither and die in seconds

items.name: The Rat Knight
items.description: In squeakling hole I squashed and curled. Amidst my kin, a kinder world

items.name: Verminform
items.description: Take the form of a rat to squeeze into any space that a rat could fit into. You return to your normal form as soon as you are in a space that allows it. You can also speak with rats, who are generally helpful.

items.name: Trust
items.description: Restore SPI when giving the benefit of the doubt in a way that leaves you vulnerable.

items.name: Modified gambeson
items.description: See below

items.name: Listening horn
items.description: When placed against a wall, hear everything from the other side in perfect clarity
